plants.name: Rice
plants.description: Rice is a type of grain that is the most important staple food for a large part of the world's human population. It is the seed of the grass species Oryza sativa.

plants.name: Maize
plants.description: Maize, also known as corn, is a grain that is one of the most widely cultivated crops in the world. It is a staple food in many countries and is also used to feed livestock.

plants.name: Jute
plants.description: Jute is a long, soft, shiny vegetable fiber that can be spun into coarse, strong threads. It is produced from plants in the genus Corchorus, which is in the mallow family Malvaceae.

plants.name: cotton
plants.description: Cotton is a soft, fluffy staple fiber that grows in a boll, or protective case, around the seeds of cotton plants of the genus Gossypium.

plants.name: coconut
plants.description: Coconut is the fruit of the coconut palm tree, which is grown in tropical regions around the world. The fruit is used for its water, milk, and meat.

plants.name: papaya
plants.description: Papaya is a fruit that is native to tropical America and is now grown in many tropical and subtropical regions of the world. It is a large, herbaceous plant with a single stem that can grow up to 20 feet tall.

plants.name: Orange
plants.description: Orange is a citrus fruit that is known for its sweet, juicy, and acid flesh.

plants.name: Apple
plants.description: Apple is a round fruit that comes in many different varieties, each with their own unique flavor and texture.

plants.name: Muskmelon
plants.description: Muskmelon is a type of melon that has a sweet, juicy, and fragrant flesh.

plants.name: Watermelon
plants.description: Watermelon is a large, round fruit that has a hard rind and a juicy, sweet interior.

plants.name: Grapes
plants.description: Grapes are small round or oval berries that grow in clusters on a vine. They are used to make wine, jelly, juice, and raisins.

plants.name: Mango
plants.description: Mango is a juicy stone fruit that comes in many different varieties. It is native to South Asia and is now grown in many tropical regions around the world.

plants.name: Banana
plants.description: Banana is a herbaceous perennial plant that is native to Southeast Asia. It is one of the oldest cultivated plants and is now grown in many tropical regions around the world.

plants.name: Pomegranate
plants.description: Pomegranate is a round fruit that has a tough red or yellow-red skin and a juicy, seed-filled interior.

plants.name: Lentil
plants.description: Lentil is a type of legume that is high in protein and is used in many different cuisines.

plants.name: Blackgram
plants.description: Blackgram, also known as urdbean is a legume that is native to India and is used in many different cuisines.

plants.name: Mungbean
plants.description: Mungbean, also known as green gram, is a legume that is native to India and is used in many different cuisines.

plants.name: Mothbeans
plants.description: Mothbeans, also known as matki, is a legume that is native to India and is used in many different cuisines.

plants.name: Pigeonpeas
plants.description: Pigeonpeas, also known as toor dal, is a legume that is native to India and is used in many different cuisines.

plants.name: Kidney beans
plants.description: Kidney beans, also known as Rajma, is a legume that is native to America and is used in many different cuisines.

plants.name: Chickpea
plants.description: Chickpea, also known as garbanzo bean, is a legume that is native to the Mediterranean and is used in many different cuisines.

plants.name: Coffee
plants.description: Coffee is a beverage made from the roasted seeds of the Coffea plant. It is one of the most popular drinks in the world.
